moves.1. e4 e5 2. f4 exf4: Castro accepts Terrezas' challenge and takes the pawn.
moves.3. Nf3 Bd6 4. d4 h6 5. e5 Bb4+: Ahead by a pawn, Castro can afford to be aggressive.
moves.9. Be2 d6 10. exd6 cxd6 11. Qa4+: Terrezas begins a risky, premature attack... maybe he felt Castro wasn't a strong enough defender to accurately riposte.
moves.11... Nc6 12. d5 Bd8 13. dxc6 b5: Castro plays to counter against Terrezas' exposed King.
moves.14. Qxb5 a6 15. Qa4 g4 16. c7+ Bd7: Terrezas should take this opportunity to castle his King into safety. However, he fails to do so...
moves.17. cxd8=Q+ Rxd8: Now with a considerable material advantage, Terrezas has to consolidate. Always castle when you have a chance...
moves.18. Qd4 gxf3 19. Qxh8 Qxe2#: Game to Castro. If Terrezas had castled...
